content: the only requirement is to knit using black yarn ● if you re a beginner you ll need to learn the basics first casting on knitting either knit or purl stitches casting on and casting off and buying black yarn ● to make an armband measure your bicep and using the 1x1 ribbing pattern knit a gauge swatch to determine how many stitches and row to knit ● knit the number of row necessary to create a fitted armband negative ease - a few less stitches than needed to circle your bicep and finally sew the bound-off edge to the cast-on edge or if you want knit this in the round as i did yarn i chose dk - urth harvest in black swatching to find your gauge 1 using your choice of yarn and needle - usually written on the yarn paper band ● i chose dk yarn and a pair of 16 us4 circular needles 2 knit a 1x1 ribbing swatch 4 wide and 4 high count your swatch s stitches ● mine is 30 sts/4 and 18 row/4 prepare your plan to knit your armband 1 measure your bicep ● i measured my bicep and found it to be 12 around 2 determine how many stitches to cast on ● i decided to reduce the number of stitches to make the band stretch around my arm ie negative ease math is used here ● from gauge - 30sts/4 x 12 = 7 5 sts/inch x 12 = 90 sts around ● to negative ease - reducing sts per inch - 6sts per inch x 12 = 72 sts ● and i reduced again for no apparent reason to 70 stitches 1 cast on 70 stitches using your favorite cast-on method - ○ i used the long tail cast on method please do look it up on youtube 2 connect your work in the round without twisting your stitches by keeping all the stitch bumps on the same side of your needle and connecting by placing the last cast-on stitch from the right needle onto the left needle and knitting the two together 3 place a marker now to keep track of your work 4 knit one row to the marker and check to be sure you haven t twisted your work 5 begin 1x1 ribbing - ○ knit a stitch ○ purl a stitch ○ continue 6 continue in a 1x1 ribbing pattern until you reach your desired height for your armband mine is 4 high 7 cast off using your favorite stretchy method ○ i used the sewn italian bindoff please do look it up on youtube put it on your arm ps if it stretches out add an elastic thread by sewing it through the edges
